holidays.name: Find a Rainbow Day
holidays.description: A whimsical day encouraging people to look for rainbows, whether after a spring shower or through a prism. It's a cheerful celebration of color and wonder!
holidays.origin: While its exact origin is unclear, the day has grown in popularity online as a way to spark joy and optimism.
holidays.funFact: Rainbows are actually full circles, but usually we only see an arc due to the ground blocking the rest!

holidays.name: World Party Day
holidays.description: A global event where people are encouraged to throw a party and celebrate joy, unity, and positivity everywhere.
holidays.origin: Conceived by Shashi Sinha in 1997 to create a worldwide day of happiness through parties.
holidays.funFact: Since its inception, World Party Day has inspired thousands of parties across over 25 countries simultaneously!

holidays.name: Tweezers Day
holidays.description: A quirky day dedicated to the handy tool we use for plucking and grooming, celebrating its precision and odd history.
holidays.origin: Unclear, but tied to appreciation of this little tool‚Äôs usefulness in beauty and science.
holidays.funFact: The first known tweezers date back to 3000 BC and were found in Mesopotamian archeological sites!

holidays.name: National Chocolate Mousse Day
holidays.description: A deliciously decadent day to enjoy the rich, airy French dessert that melts in your mouth and delights your taste buds.
holidays.origin: Celebrated in the United States to honor the classic chocolate mousse dessert.
holidays.funFact: Despite its name meaning 'foam' in French, chocolate mousse was originally both a savory and sweet dish!
